So let's say you have a class that generically handles grabbing
appropriate=
 beans, db connections, what-have-you. Let's say further
that in order for =
it to do this correctly for your purposes, you've
created a custom runner a=
nd annotated your file using the appropriate
@RunWith(MyCustomRunner.class)=
 notation. 

Then you subclass that file some moderately large number of ti=
mes, say
a dozen times at the next level and who-knows-how-many subclass ea=
ch
of those, where each is doing its own various and sundry tests. 

Then l=
et's say you run one of those tests directly.

What runner should it use if=
 none is specified in the subclass? The
default "TestClassRunner" or the pa=
rent class's "MyCustomRunner"? 

Currently it uses the default runner rathe=
r than its parents' custom
one. Would it make sense to have runners be inhe=
rited from their parents?
